children.name: to decide which one you want
choose
children.definition: to decide which one of several things or possibilities you want:
examples: ▪ I can’t decide what I want. You choose.
▪ Will you help me choose a present for Warren?
make a choice[] to make a decision, especially a difficult decision, about which thing to choose:
I felt I was being forced to make a choice between my family and my job.
It had been difficult to leave her unhappy marriage, but she had made her choice.
make the right/ wrong choice
Sean’s decided to study law - I hope he’s made the right choice.

children.name: choose to do something
examples: ▪ Why do so few women choose to become engineers?

children.name: choose whether/ which/ when etc
examples: ▪ It took her three hours to choose which dress to wear.

children.name: choose betweenchoose one of two things
examples: ▪ We have to choose between doing geography or studying another language.

children.name: choose fromchoose from amongseveralthings
examples: ▪ Import restrictions will reduce the number of cars buyers have to choose from.

children.name: pick
children.definition: to choose sth, especially without thinking very carefully about it:
examples: Pick a number from one to five
Let me pick the movie tonight - I don’t want to see another comedy
Students have to pick three courses from a list of 15.
I don’t know which colour to pick.
Who’s going topick the teamfor the match on Saturday?
take your pick[]especially spokenif sb can take their pick, they can choose exactly the thing that they want without anything limiting their choice: thoải mái lựa chọn
take your pick of
She showed me the box of kittens and told me I could take my pick.
With so many houses for sale, buyers with cash can take their pick.
The program’s top graduate took her pick of five job offers.

children.name: select
children.definition: to choose something, especially after thinking carefully: lựa chọn
examples: The committee will meet to select a new chairman.
All our instructors are carefully selected.
It’s very important that parents select the right school for a child with learning difficulties.
Our wines have been carefully selected from vineyards throughout Europe.

children.name: select something from something
examples: The team’s name was selected from more than 1,700 suggestions.

children.name: go for
children.definition: sth spoken informal to choose something because you think it is the most attractive, interesting, or enjoyable: chọn
examples: I don’t usually go for horror movies.
Whenever we eat out, she always goes for the most expensive thing on the menu.

children.name: the decision you make when you choose
choice
children.definition: if you have a choice, you can choose between several things: lựa chọn

children.name: have a choice
examples: Students have a choice between German and Spanish.

children.name: make a choice
children.definition: choose something
examples: One of our course advisors can help you to make your choice.

children.name: give somebody a choice
examples: Her doctor gave her a choice: take medicine or lose weight.

children.name: be faced with a choice
examples: He was faced with a difficult choice.

children.name: have no choice
children.definition: but to do sth
examples: The men had no choice but to obey.

children.name: leave sb with no choice
examples: I was left with no choice but to resign.

children.name: exercise your choiceformal
children.definition: make a choice - used especially when talking about someone using their right to choose
examples: Everyone should have the right to exercise choice in matters of relationships.

children.name: the right/wrong choice
examples: I think you’ve made the right choice.

children.name: a difficult choice
examples: It was a very difficult choice for me.

children.name: a stark choice
children.definition: a choice between two unpleasant things that you must make
examples: We faced a stark choice: steal or starve.

children.definition: a
examples: free choiceStudents have an entirely free choice of what to study at university.

children.name: an informed choice
children.definition: a choice based on knowledge of the facts about something
examples: The patient should have enough information to make an informed choice.

children.name: consumer choice
children.definition: the opportunity for people to choose between different products
examples: I believe in free trade and consumer choice.

children.name: parental choice
examples: The aim is to extend parental choice in education.

children.name: freedom of choice
examples: Patients should have more freedom of choice.

children.name: given the choice
children.definition: if you had a choice
examples: Given the choice, I probably wouldn’t work.

children.name: have no choice in the matter
examples: The village people had no choice in the matter.

children.name: choice between
examples: Voters have a choice between three main political parties.

children.name: choice of
examples: You have a choice of hotel or self-catering accommodation.
He has to make some important choices.
They gave us no choice in the matter.

children.name: by choiceif you do something by choice, you do it because you want to do it and not because you are forced to do it : lựa chọn, tự lựa chọn (không ai ép họ)
examples: He says he lives on the street by choice.
She lives alone by choice.

children.name: choice
children.definition: sb/sth that has been chosen: sự lựa chọn
examples: Maria was very pleased with her choice.

children.name: first/ second/ third choicethe thing you wanted most, the thing you wanted most after that etc
examples: Greece was our first choice for a vacation, but all the flights were full.
My first choice of college was Stanford.

children.name: choice of
examples: I don’t like his choice of friends.
I don’t really like her choice of jewellery.
I think London was agood choiceas a venue.

children.name: selection
children.definition: a small group of the best things that have been chosen from a larger group: tuyển tập, chọn lọc, bộ sư tập

children.name: selection of
examples: She showed me a selection of her drawings.

children.name: a selection of songs from ‘West Side Story’
examples: To order, just write your selections on the form.

children.name: selection from
examples: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.

children.name: chosen
children.definition: use this about the person or thing that has been chosen: đã chọn
examples: I want my children to be successful in their chosen careers.
You have two minutes to answer questions on your chosen subject.

children.name: well-chosencarefully and successfully chosen
examples: The flavorful vegetables require only melted butter and some well-chosen herbs.

children.name: selected
children.definition: carefully chosen from a larger group, usually for a particular purpose: được chọn
examples: There is a discount of 10% off selected items in this store.
The book is a collection of selected essays by D.H.Lawrence.

children.name: specially/ carefully selected
examples: A small and carefully selected group of friends has been invited to the wedding.

children.name: handpicked
children.definition: / hand-picked people who are hand-picked have been specially chosen by sb because they are the best or most suitable people for a particular job, position etc: sàng lọc
examples: The school is staffed with handpicked educators and psychiatric specialists.
With a small, hand-picked squad of ex-paratroopers, Collins managed to get through the defences.

children.name: of your choice
children.definition: sth of your choice has been chosen by you, with nothing limiting which one you choose: tùy chọn
examples: The magician told her to hold up three cards of her choice.
You could win a fabulous weekend break at a luxurious hotel of your choice.

children.name: the range of people or things that you can choose from
choice
children.definition: the range of people or things that you can choose from:
examples: It was a small shop and there wasn’t much choice.

children.name: choice of
examples: There is a choice of four different colours.
We offer awide choiceof wines and beers.
Consumers these days arespoilt for choiceUK(= have a lot of things to choose from).
The school seems OK, but there isn’t a great choice of courses.

children.name: have a choicebe able to choose from several things
examples: With her high grades and athletic skill, Celeste had her choice of colleges.

children.name: have no choice but to do sthto be forced to do sth because there is nothing else you can choose
examples: Spooner says he had no choice but to file for bankruptcy.

children.name: wide choicea lot of things to choose from
examples: There is a wide choice of hotels and hostels in the town.

children.name: option
children.definition: one of the things that you can choose to do in a particular situation: lựa chọn
examples: There are a number of options available.
Hehadtwooptions.
This was not the onlyoption opento him.
option for
a range of options for cutting costs
one/another option is to do something
Another option is to rent somewhere for six months.
option of doing something
Shehad the option ofstaying for an extra year.
Teenage mothers oftenhave no option but to(= have no other choice except to )live with their parents.

children.name: have an option
examples: At the moment, children have the option of leaving school at 16.|In a situation like this, you have two options.

children.name: give/offer somebody an option
examples: Some employees were given the option of retiring early.|Buyers will usually be offered the option of paying in instalments.

children.name: choose an option
examples: Fewer women are choosing the option of motherhood.

children.name: go for an option
children.definition: choose an option
examples: Which option do you think they'll go for?

children.name: take
children.definition: up
examples: an option(= choose an option )America was persuaded not to take up the option of military action.

children.name: look at an option
children.definition: consider an option
examples: You have to look at every option as your business develops.

children.name: limit your options
children.definition: limit what you can choose to do
examples: If you don’t go to college, it may limit your options.

children.name: a good/better option
examples: Renting a house may be a better option than buying.

children.name: an attractive option
children.definition: one that sounds or is good
examples: If time is short, taking the car to northern France is an attractive option.

children.name: a realistic/real/serious option
children.definition: something that you can really choose to do
examples: I wanted to start my own business but financially it was never a realistic option.

children.name: a viable/practical option
children.definition: something you can choose that will be successful
examples: Surgery may be a viable option when all else fails.

children.name: a popular option
examples: Independent sixth-form colleges are becoming a popular option.

children.name: a cheap option
examples: We urgently need to find a cheaper option than oil or gas.

children.name: a safe option
children.definition: one that involves no risk
examples: A special savings account can be a safe option.

children.name: sb’s preferred optionformal
children.definition: the option someone likes best
examples: The new scheme appears to be the airport management’s preferred option.

children.name: an easy option
children.definition: alsoa soft optionBritish English
examples: (= a choice which is not difficult, or which needs the least effort )For most people, divorce is never an easy option.

children.name: an option is open/available to somebody
children.definition: a particular choice is available to someone
examples: Giving a prison sentence is only one of the options open to the judge.

children.name: keep/leave your options open
children.definition: to not limit what you can choose to do later
examples: Studying a broad range of subjects helps to keep your options open.

children.name: have no/little option but to do something
children.definition: have no other choice than to do something
examples: I had no option but to fire him.

children.name: a range of options
examples: The council is considering a range of options for improving the city’s transport system.

children.name: alternative
children.definition: sth you can choose to do or use instead of sth else: thay thế

children.name: a good/attractive alternative
examples: If you don’t want curtains, blinds are a good alternative.

children.name: a possible/acceptable/satisfactory alternative
examples: I’m busy tomorrow but Wednesday is a possible alternative.

children.name: a real/serious alternative
examples: Co-operation offers the only real alternative.

children.name: a viable alternative
children.definition: that can work as successfully
examples: Hydrogen offers a viable alternative to petrol and diesel.

children.name: a practical alternative
examples: This treatment represents a practical alternative to surgery.

children.name: a cheap alternative
examples: A take-away is a cheap alternative to eating out.

children.name: a safe alternative
examples: Will there ever be a safe alternative to nuclear power?

children.name: a healthy alternative
examples: Low-fat biscuits are a healthy alternative to cake.

children.name: have an alternative
examples: You have a few alternatives to choose from.

children.name: offer/provide an alternative
examples: If your first choice is not available, we always have alternatives to offer.

children.name: suggest an alternative
examples: Do you have an alternative you can suggest?

children.name: seek an alternative
examples: People are seeking alternatives to meat-based dishes.

children.name: find an alternative
examples: The program is directed to finding alternatives to oil and natural gas.

children.name: have no/little alternative
children.definition: but to do something
examples: He had no alternative but to resign.

children.name: leave somebody with no alternative
children.definition: but to do something
examples: I was left with no alternative but to seek legal advice.

children.name: alternative to
examples: Is there aviable alternativeto the present system?
If payment is not received legal action will be ouronly alternative.
Ihad no alternativebut to report him to the police.
He quickly assessed what alternatives were open to him.

children.name: selection
children.definition: a group of things of a particular type, often of things that are for sale:
examples: There's abig selectionto choose from.
selection of
awide selectionof shellfish
They only have alimited selectionof his books.

children.name: a wide/large/big selection
examples: The museum shop offers a wide selection of items.

children.name: a good selection
examples: There is a good selection of bars and cafés nearby.

children.name: a varied selection
examples: The supermarket has a varied selection of fruit juice drinks especially for children.

children.name: a small/limited selection
examples: We also have a small selection of offices for daily hire.

children.name: to choose from U
children.definition: to choose from if there is a particular range of things or people to choose from, you can choose what you want from that range:
examples: There are a lot of good restaurants downtown to choose from.
Portland has so many theaters to choose from.

children.name: choosy
children.definition: someone who is choosy chooses things carefully and only wants the things they think are the best: kén chọn
examples: ▪ I get offered a lot of work now, so I can be more choosy.

children.name: choosy about
examples: ▪ She’s very choosy about what airline she travels on.

children.name: fussy
children.definition: /picky informal sb who is fussy or picky is difficult to please because they only like a few things and will only accept exactly what they want: cầu kì
examples: ▪ Maybe I’m too picky, but all the guys I meet seem so boring.

children.name: fussy/picky about
examples: ▪ She was always very fussy about her clothes.

children.name: picky/fussy eatersb who will only eat the few things they like
examples: ▪ We’re not really picky eaters, but we don’t eat much fast food.

children.name: selective
children.definition: someone who is selective chooses things very carefully because they want to choose the best, most suitable etc: kén chọn
examples: You’ve got to be very selective when choosing a roommate.

children.name: selective about
examples: People are becoming more and more selective about the food they eat these days.

children.name: particular
children.definition: be  about to be very careful about choosing only the very best of something, or only exactly what you like, usually with the result that people think you are too careful about it: đòi hỏi, kỹ tính

children.name: be particular about
examples: He’s very particular about the clothes he buys.

children.name: be particular about what/where etc
examples: Monica is particular about what she eats - no meat, and only organic vegetables.

children.name: shop around
children.definition: to look at or try several different possibilities before choosing the one which is the best, cheapest etc:
examples: ▪ Never buy the first car you see. Always shop around.
▪ Shop around a little bit before you choose a therapist.
shop around for
▪ You should shop around for a better price

children.name: to finally choose sth after considering all the possibilities
decide on
children.definition: to finally choose sth, especially when making the decision has been difficult or has taken a long time: chọn được, chọn ra được, quyết định
examples: Have you decided on a name for the baby yet?
We couldn’t decide on a new color for the kitchen, so we left it white.
Thomas had decided on a career as a writer.

children.name: opt
children.definition: to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another, after thinking carefully about all the possibilities

children.name: opt for
examples: After college, Ruffin opted for the Army over college.
We finally opted for the wood finish.

children.name: opt to do sth
examples: When her parents divorced, Mary Ann opted to live with her father.
Many young people are opting to go on to college.

children.name: settle on
children.definition: sth if sb, especially a group of people, settles on sth, they finally agree to choose that thing after considering all the possibilities, discussing it etc: thống nhất chọn
examples: Hiroaki wanted white and I wanted black, so we settled on grey.
Can we at least settle on a date for our next meeting?
We finally settled on Miami as the site of our next conference.

children.name: plump for
children.definition: British informal to choose one of two or more things after thinking carefully about it, especially if you have had difficulty in deciding:
examples: They thought of going to Madeira or mainland Spain, but finally plumped for the Canary Islands.
She looked at every sweater in the shop before plumping for a red mohair one.

children.name: to choose one person or thing from among a lot of similar things
single out
children.definition: to choose sb/sth from among a group of similar people or things,because they are better, worse, more important etc than the others,especially in order to praise them or criticize them: chọn ra, lựa ra.
examples: Could you single out one factor that is more important than the others?
His teacher was always singling him out, calling on him when his hand wasn’t even raised.
Why should he be singled out for special treatment?
One student was singled out for special attention.

children.name: single sb/sth out for something
examples: Captain Withers was singled out for special mention and was awarded the Military Cross.

children.name: pick out
children.definition: to consider a group of similar people or things and to choose the one that you like most: lựa ra
examples: He looked through the tourist guide and picked out a few exhibitions to see while he was in town.
The editor looked through the file, picking the best models out for the fashion shoot.

children.name: to choose sb/sth for a particular purpose
choose
children.definition: chọn
examples: ▪ A committee will be selected to choose the new leader.

children.name: choose somebody/something as something
examples: ▪ Seattle has been chosen as the venue for next year’s conference.

children.name: choose somebody/something for something
examples: ▪ Many of the industries chosen for government investment have in fact already gone bankrupt.

children.name: choose somebody/something to do something
examples: ▪ The fabric that she chose to be made into a dress is a combination of silk and cotton.

children.name: name
children.definition: verbCHOOSE

children.name: 3. to choose someone or something
examples: Just name the time and I'll be there on the dot.
Name your conditions/terms/price.
Ms Martinez has been named(as)(= she will be) the new Democratic candidate.

children.name: of your own accord
children.definition: ofyourown accord

children.name: If you do something of your own accord, you do it without being asked to do it
examples: She came of her own accord. No one asked her to come.

children.name: torn between
children.definition: If you are  two possibilities, you find it very difficult to choose between them.

children.name: selection
children.definition: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things:
examples: The judges have made their final selection.
selection of
the selection of a new leader
selection for
He had narrowly missed selection for the team.
selection as
Perlman’s selection as the party’s candidate

children.name: make a selection
examples: Students should be able to make a selection from a range of reference materials.

children.name: careful selection
examples: Adair emphasises the importance of careful selection of team members.

children.name: random selection
children.definition: choosing without any reason or order
examples: the random selection of genes

children.name: the final selection
examples: The final selection will be based on local requirements.

children.name: the selection process/procedure
examples: Before the selection process begins, candidates need to be clear about what the job entails.

children.name: the selection criteria
children.definition: the set of reasons used for choosing something
examples: What are your selection criteria?

children.name: a selection committee
children.definition: a group of people responsible for choosing something
examples: All the exhibitors have been carefully chosen by a very experienced selection committee.
